title: Please enable the autocomplete feature
body_html:
🚀 Feature

Make it possible for the text editors to autocomplete methods, like torch.randn().

Motivation

Intellisense is a gift to developers. We NEED it, Please.

Pitch

I've looked up the .py files and .h files, and it seems the problem is due to that all the methods cannot be indexed are only declared in head files and implemented in the .pyd and dlls that editors can not deal with.

Can you make some changes, like re-declaring these methods in the .py files, to fix this problem?

Please correct me if I'm wrong.

body:
## 🚀 Feature
<!-- A clear and concise description of the feature proposal -->
Make it possible for the text editors to autocomplete methods, like torch.randn().

## Motivation

<!-- Please outline the motivation for the proposal. Is your feature request related to a problem? e.g., I'm always frustrated when [...]. If this is related to another GitHub issue, please link here too -->
Intellisense is a gift to developers. We NEED it, Please.

## Pitch

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
I've looked up the .py files and .h files, and it seems the problem is due to that all the methods cannot be indexed are only declared in head files and implemented in the .pyd and dlls that editors can not deal with.

Can you make some changes, like re-declaring these methods in the .py files, to fix this problem?

Please correct me if I'm wrong.
